div0.head: *h
div0.entryFree:
*hh, h)=ta (q.v.), to/, indecl., eighth (later seventh) letter of the Gr. alphabet; as numeral h/,= o)ktw/ and o)/gdoos, but h(NUM),= 8 , 000 . In most local alphabets of v B.C. and earlier it represents
h, in others (incl. the Ion. = later general Gr. alphabet) one of the long
ē sounds (cf. bh= bh=). Described by E. Fr. 382.5 , Agatho 4.2 .

h)/ (A), Ep. also h)e/ (in signf. A. 11
h)/ (or h)e/) folld. by h)= (or h)=e), v. infr.), Conj. with two chief senses, Disj. (
or) and Comp. (
than). DISJUNCTIVE,
or, e)gw\ . . h)\ a)/llos *)axaiw=n

either . . or, h)\ nu=n dhqu/nont' h)\ u(/steron au)=tis i)o/nta

, Fr. 138 ; h)/toi . . h)/ . .

Or. 21.260a . in Questions or Deliberations in Disj. form(the accentuation is h)\ (h)e/) folld. by h)= (h)=e), Hdn. Gr. 2.24 , al., A.D. or a mortal? Od. 6.149 , cf. 1.226 , 4.314 , 372 , 643 , 20.130 , 21.194 , Il. 10.63 , 425 , 534 , 15.203 : accented h)=, Hdn.Gr. 2.145 , al., but h)/ freq. in codd. of Hom. and always in codd. of later writers: h)/kousas h)\ ou)k h)/kousas h)\ kwfh=| le/gw; A. Th. 202 ; a)/rti de\ h(/keis h)\ pa/lai; Pl. Cri. 43a ; kakourgei=n dei= h)\ ou)/; ib. 49c ; preceded by po/teron, po/teron dokei= soi ka/kion ei)=nai, to\ a)dikei=n h)\ to\ a)dikei=sqai; Id. Grg. 474c , etc. Indirect questions, freq. epexegetic of a preceding question and identical in form with direct questions.

h)\ h)\ siw/pa

OC 863 , 1102 , or a)lla/, as in A. Ag. 276 , Ch. 774 :—by Crasis h)= combines with a)/ra in Att. and the koinh/ to a)=ra (q. v.), in all other dialects (cf. A.D.
